Name: San Tommaso

Name: San Tommaso
Review Text: San Thomas is a better one of many Argentinean restaurants in Amsterdam. The meat is actually pretty good. The sides are pretty standard. Service quick. The interior is abundantly decorated in a slightly inconsistent style, with amazing lights on the ceiling.

Name: San Tommaso
Review Text: The staff are friendly, welcoming and polite and the place is well designed and spacious! The menu is extensive with lots of choice and the waiters are great in adding bits/taking away to cater for fussy eaters and children! ‚Ä¶

Name: San Tommaso
Review Text: Great Italian restaurant. The service was fast and efficient. We ordered pizza, miss salad and pesto spaghetti. Every bite was delicious and accurate. I'd given them more than 5 stars if I could. They totally deserve it.

Name: San Tommaso
Review Text: The food was very nice, perhaps not worth the money though. Unfortunately the service was extremely slow and the one waiter decided to pick his favourite tables and flirt embarrassingly with the customers whilst others waited a really long time to pay. I would not return unfortunately

Name: San Tommaso
Review Text: Pizzas were better than those I ate in Italy. Pasta was fresh...beer was clean.....loved my experience. Do not order cola though...portion sizes small..no lemon or ice and flat! My only gripe. Would still and did go back three times in 3 days.

Name: San Tommaso

Review Text: Excellent food, lovely. Just expensive, but worth it.

Name: San Tommaso
Review Text: Good food, good service, great location but a bit pricey

Name: San Tommaso
Review Text: Food was excellent.. Must try mushroom and garlic as hot starter (Item number 211).. Vegetable soup is also delicious... Name: San Tommaso
Review Text: We had a party of 10 and it was like 'lets check out this place'. Being veggies, we totally loved the pizza and pastas. They made me a penne arribiata with extra garlic with mushrooms and it was better then what I've had in London. Very nice staff with good service

Name: San Tommaso
